Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Grand Style, pottery heavy chalice; white slip on exterior, glazed streaky brown with trace of added white band at bottom of sherd; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: the number 368 is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd. The thickness of the sherd suggests that it belonged to a heavy chalice. Heavy chalices are found in the Mature Animal Style and the Grand Style. The foot of some Grand Style chalices is decorated with concentric white bands. For parallels, see Lemos no. 800 from Pitane.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0739) (phase 2)
